951.question: What are the qualitative experiments performed on benchmark datasets?
951.response: {'Answer': 'The qualitative experiments performed on benchmark datasets are shown in Table 1. The nearest neighbors for each word are shown for different co-occurrences. For example, the nearest neighbors of “rock” when Co. is 0 are “rock”, “sedimentary”, “molten”, “granite”, “felsic”, “carvings”, and “kiln”. The nearest neighbors of “rock” when Co. is 1 are “rock”, “albums”, “rap”, “album”, “bam baa taa”, “jazzy”, “remix”, “star”, “ishiro”, “finale”, “sequel”, “godzilla”, “hulk”, and “cameo”.'}
951.answer:
Spearman correlation values of GM_KL model evaluated on the benchmark word similarity datasets.
Evaluation results of GM_KL model on the entailment datasets such as entailment pairs dataset created from WordNet, crowdsourced dataset of 79 semantic relations labelled as entailed or not and annotated distributionally similar nouns dataset.
